argumentText:
ARGUMENT

| Step | Hyp | Ref | Expression |
|---|---|---|---|

| 1 |  | #P_df-2 | |- 2 = ( 1 + 1 ) |
| 2 | 1 | #P_eqcomi | |- ( 1 + 1 ) = 2 |
\
 One plus one equals two.  Using proof-shortening techniques pioneered by Mr.  Mel L. O'Cat, along with the latest supercomputer technology, Prof. Loof Lirpa and colleagues were able to shorten Whitehead and Russell's 360-page proof that 1+1=2 in _Principia Mathematica_ to this remarkable proof only two steps long, thus establishing a new world's record for this famous theorem.  (Contributed by Prof.  Loof Lirpa, 1-Apr-2008.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
